line_1: To wyte her countrymen wi' treason!
line_2: Alake! that e'er my Muse has reason,

line_1: To wyte her countrymen wi' treason!
line_2: But monie daily weet their weason

line_1: To wyte her countrymen wi' treason!
line_2: An' hardly, in a winter season,
WHILE, Strephon, thus you teize one,

line_1: To enter in with covert treason,
line_2: O'erthrow the drowsy guard of reason,

line_1: Will, tho' she shake their sides, think nature treason,
line_2: And see one damn'd, ere — laugh without a reason.

line_1: In such a state as their's, is downright treason.
line_2: Their word's sufficient; and to ask a reason,
No matter why — to ask a Reason

line_1: That impudence in love's no treason.

line_2: But should you from these fumes of reason
